title: Neighborhood Council 10Y
about: The Neighborhood Council (formerly Neighborhood Crime Prevention Council) for beat 10Y exists as a forum to find community solutions to ongoing problems in the neighborhoods of Longfellow (North of 40th St) and Santa Fe. We believe in a holistic approach to crime prevention and work in partnership with the City of Oakland to address ongoing problems in our neighborhoods.   Monthly meetings will be attended by a Community Resource Officer (CRO) – a specifically-designated OPD officer whose position is funded by Measure Z. Due to funding cuts and re-prioritization, 10Y has been deprioritized and has no official assignment for Neighborhood Services Coordinator or CRO. In the meantime, Officer Silvestre Triana, who serves as a CRO in area 2 has offered to join. Any community member (lives, works, or worships) who wishes to regularly attend and participate in meetings is also welcome to join by signing up here.
schedule:
NC 10Y meets on the 4th Wednesday of each month (except December and November). Any community member (lives, works, or worships) who wishes to regularly attend and participate in meetings is also welcome to join by signing up here. Our next meeting is on Wednesday, February 22, 2023 at 6:30 PM on zoom.  We are working to find a space to host hybrid meetings for those who would rather attend in person (if you have a space that is amenable to host a hybrid meeting, please email yates@duck.com).
